events.title: Abnormal Serum Cholesterol and Triglyceride Levels
events.description: The patient has a serum cholesterol level of 5.3 mmol/L, which is above the normal range (< 5 mmol/L), and serum triglyceride levels of 3.2 mmol/L, exceeding the normal limit (< 2 mmol/L). These findings indicate potential dyslipidemia, which may increase cardiovascular risk.

events.title: Elevated Serum Cholesterol/HDL Ratio
events.description: The serum cholesterol/HDL ratio is recorded at 5.41 mmol/mmol, which is considered elevated. This ratio is a significant marker for cardiovascular risk assessment, indicating a higher likelihood of heart disease.

events.title: Low Serum Creatinine Level
events.description: The serum creatinine level is noted at 61 umol/L, which is slightly below the normal range (62 - 106 umol/L). While this may not be clinically significant, it could suggest a need for further renal function evaluation.

events.title: Low Serum Sodium Level
events.description: The serum sodium level is recorded at 136 mmol/L, which is at the lower limit of the normal range (136 - 145 mmol/L). This finding may warrant monitoring for potential hyponatremia-related symptoms.

events.title: Low Serum HDL Cholesterol Level
events.description: The serum HDL cholesterol level is measured at 0.98 mmol/L, which is below the desirable level. Low HDL levels are associated with an increased risk of cardiovascular disease.
